br.com.depasser.web.resource
Interface Loader

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClasspathLoader, WebApplicationFileLoader
public interface Loader

Resource loaders are responsible to load content from an identifier. Content can be loaded from many different places like file system, classpath, etc.

Author:
Vinicius Isola (viniciusisola@gmail.com)

Method Summary
 boolean hasResource(java.lang.String identifier)
          Check if this loader has the resource specified by the identifier.
 long lastUpdated(java.lang.String identifier)
          Return the last time the resource was updated.
 java.lang.String loadResource(java.lang.String identifier)
          Load a resource content using an identifier.
 

Method Detail

hasResource

boolean hasResource(java.lang.String identifier)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Check if this loader has the resource specified by the identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier to check for.
Returns:
True if this loader has access to the resource specified.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If any exception occurs while accessing the resource.

loadResource

java.lang.String loadResource(java.lang.String identifier)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Load a resource content using an identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - The resource identifier.
Returns:
Content for the resource or null if not found.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

lastUpdated

long lastUpdated(java.lang.String identifier)
Return the last time the resource was updated.

Parameters:
identifier - The resource identifier.
Returns:
A timestamp that tells the last time the resource was updated or zero if the resource cannot be updated if not specified.
